bio:treatment.discussion: In North America, Fissidens serratus is restricted to peninsular Florida, extending north to Leon and Jefferson counties. The species is characterized by distinct, 1-papillose laminal cells and sharply serrate leaf margin, often coarsely and irregularly so on the vaginant laminae. Perichaetial leaves can be limbate and entire on proximal parts of vaginant laminae. Filamentous, muticellular gemmae have been observed at the stem apices of African plants. Variety leptochaete (Dusén) Bruggeman-Nannenga & Pursell (tropical America, tropical Africa, New Zealand) differs by having an intralaminal limbidium on vaginant laminae of most or all leaves.
